item.title: Research
item.description: Working Papers Tracking Earnings Ability over the Business Cycle. On the Tension between Maximum Sustainable Yield and Maximum Economic Yield. Appendix. Slides Published Papers Labor-Market Polarization over the Business Cycle, with Christopher L. Foote. In NBER Macroeconomics Annual, vol. 29, edited by Jonathan Parker and Michael Woodford, 371–413, 2014. Chicago: University of Chicago Press. Also available as NBER Working Paper No. 21030. Ecosystem Externalities in Fisheries, with Daniel S.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Intermediate Microeconomic Theory, ECON 401 Fall 2018 Materials for Intermediate Microeconomic Theory, ECON 401, with Dr. Chris Proulx. The course website is here. Winter 2015 Section notes for Intermediate Microeconomic Theory, ECON 401, with Dr. Chris Proulx Introduction, review of mathematics Budget sets, preferences Where we are: constraints, preferences, utility functions Utility functions Choice Problems Comparative statics and the WARP police WARP/SARP, Slutsky The Slutsky equation Endowments Intertemporal choice Consumer’s surplus, EV, CV Market demand A notion of equilibrium Technology and profit maximization Cost minimization Cost curves Firm supply Industry supply and brief review for the exam Monopoly Getting to know the customer: Monopoly behavior A too brief introduction to game theory Applications of game theory: Oligopoly The Edgeworth box: Exchange and general equilibrium Exchange continued More Edgeworth box and auctions Externalities Asymmetric information Yet more Edgeworth box * Leontief * Quasilinear
